Have a mark, have a TrademarkÂ®

09 Aug 2006

Protecting the name of your software is not that expensive as you might think. Quoting http://www.patentpending.com/tmark.html "Cost on a simple application is $875 including the $325 U.S. Patent Office fee. Your only other cost will occur about six to nine months later if we have to amend your application due to a request for an amendment or office action from the Patent Office. " It remains unclear wether it's a one state, U.S. or includes international registration. Any ideas? The actual search for pricing of Â® is inspired by Guy Kawasaki blog entry where he encourages and clears up issues surrounding trademarks in software development. Protecting your trademark will always be a choice but if your stakes are high or just trying to get additional VC funding then protecting your trademark should be worth the money. Think how valuable is PorscheÂ®, literally :) I'm not urging you to protect every .com domain you have :D Btw, how many .com domains do YOU have?
